slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचभूय एव महाबाहो श‍ृणु मे परमं वच: ।यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: The Blessed Lord said: Once again, O mighty-armed one, listen to My supreme word, which I shall speak to you who are beloved, desiring your welfare.

slokas: न मे विदु: सुरगणा: प्रभवं न महर्षय: ।अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वश: ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: Neither the hosts of gods nor the great sages know My origin; for I am the source of the gods and the great sages in every way.

slokas: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् ।असम्मूढ: स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापै: प्रमुच्यते ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: He who knows Me as unborn and without beginning, as the great Lord of the worlds, is undeluded among mortals and is freed from all sins.

slokas: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोह: क्षमा सत्यं दम: शम: ।सुखं दु:खं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: Intelligence, knowledge, non-delusion, forgiveness, truth, self-restraint, calmness, happiness, sorrow, existence, non-existence, fear, and also fearlessness.

slokas: अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयश: ।भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधा: ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: Non-violence, equanimity, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy — these various qualities of beings arise from Me alone.

slokas: महर्षय: सप्‍त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा ।मद्भ‍ावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमा: प्रजा: ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: The great sages, the seven ancient ones, and the four Manus, who are my mind-born progeny, from whom all these creatures in the world have descended.

slokas: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वत: ।सोऽविकल्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशय: ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: He who truly understands this divine glory and power of Mine is united with unwavering yoga; there is no doubt about it.

slokas: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्त: सर्वं प्रवर्तते ।इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विता: ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the origin of everything; from Me, everything emanates. Understanding this, the wise, endowed with devotion, worship Me.

slokas: मच्च‍ित्ता मद्ग‍तप्राणा बोधयन्त: परस्परम् ।कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: With their minds fixed on Me, their lives devoted to Me, enlightening one another, and always speaking of Me, they are satisfied and delighted.

slokas: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् ।ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: To those who are constantly devoted and who worship with love, I give the understanding by which they come to Me.

slokas: तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तम: ।नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: Out of compassion for them, I, dwelling within their hearts, destroy the darkness born of ignorance with the shining lamp of knowledge.

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचपरं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् ।पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Brahman, the ultimate abode, the most sacred, the eternal divine Person, the primal God, unborn and all-pervading.

slokas: आहुस्त्वामृषय: सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा ।असितो देवलो व्यास: स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: All the sages say this of you, as does the divine sage Narada, as well as Asita, Devala, and Vyasa; and you yourself tell me this.

slokas: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव ।न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवा: ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: I consider all that you say to me as true, O Keshava. Indeed, neither the gods nor the demons know your manifestation, O Lord.

slokas: स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम ।भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: You alone know yourself by yourself, O Supreme Person, O source of all beings, lord of all beings, God of gods, ruler of the universe.

slokas: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतय: ।याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: You should completely describe your divine glories, by which you pervade all these worlds.

slokas: कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् ।केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: How should I, always meditating on you, understand you as a yogi? In which aspects or forms should I think of you, O Lord?

slokas: विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन ।भूय: कथय तृप्‍तिर्हि श‍ृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: O Janardana, describe in detail your yoga and divine glories again. I am not satisfied with hearing your nectar-like words.

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचहन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतय: ।प्राधान्यत: कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: The Blessed Lord said: Certainly, I will tell you of My divine glories, O best of the Kurus, but only the principal ones, for there is no end to My vastness.

slokas: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थित: ।अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: I am the Self, O Gudakesha, seated in the hearts of all creatures. I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings.

slokas: आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंश‍ुमान् ।मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: Of the Ādityas, I am Viṣṇu; of the luminaries, I am the radiant sun; of the Maruts, I am Marīci; of the constellations, I am the moon.

slokas: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासव: ।इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: Of the Vedas, I am the Sama Veda; of the gods, I am Vasava (Indra). Of the senses, I am the mind; and of living beings, I am consciousness.

slokas: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् ।वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरु: शिखरिणामहम् ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: Among the Rudras, I am Shankara (Shiva); among the Yakshas and Rakshasas, I am the Lord of Wealth (Kubera). Among the Vasus, I am Pavaka (Agni); and among the mountains, I am Meru.

slokas: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् ।सेनानीनामहं स्कन्द: सरसामस्मि सागर: ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: Know me, O Partha, to be the chief among priests, Brihaspati. Of commanders, I am Skanda; of bodies of water, I am the ocean.

slokas: महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् ।यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालय: ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: Among the great sages, I am Bhrigu; among words, I am the single syllable 'Om'. Among sacrifices, I am the sacrifice of silent repetition (japa); among immovable things, I am the Himalayas.

slokas: अश्वत्थ: सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारद: ।गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथ: सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनि: ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: Among all trees, I am the Ashvattha (sacred fig tree); among divine sages, I am Narada; among Gandharvas, I am Chitraratha; and among perfected beings, I am the sage Kapila.

slokas: उच्‍चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भ‍वम् ।ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम् ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: Among horses, know me to be Ucchaihshravas, born of nectar; among lordly elephants, Airavata; and among men, the king.

slokas: आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् ।प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्प: सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकि: ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: Of weapons, I am the thunderbolt; of cows, I am the wish-fulfilling cow (Kamadhuk). Of causes of procreation, I am Kandarpa (the god of love); of serpents, I am Vasuki.

slokas: अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् ।पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यम: संयमतामहम् ॥ २९ ॥
slokas_translated: Of the serpents, I am Ananta; of aquatic beings, I am Varuna. Of the ancestors, I am Aryaman; of those who enforce discipline, I am Yama.

slokas: प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां काल: कलयतामहम् ।मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम् ॥ ३० ॥
slokas_translated: Of the Daityas, I am Prahlada; of reckoners, I am Time. Among beasts, I am the lion; among birds, I am Garuda.

slokas: पवन: पवतामस्मि राम: शस्त्रभृतामहम् ।झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas_translated: Of the purifiers, I am the wind; of the wielders of weapons, I am Rama; of the fishes, I am the makara; of the rivers, I am the Ganges.

slokas: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन ।अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वाद: प्रवदतामहम् ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas_translated: Of creations, I am the beginning, the end, and also the middle, O Arjuna. Of sciences, I am the knowledge of the self, and of those who debate, I am the reasoning.

slokas: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्व: सामासिकस्य च ।अहमेवाक्षय: कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुख: ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas_translated: Among letters, I am the letter A, and among compounds, I am the dual. I am the imperishable time; I am the dispenser, facing all directions.

slokas: मृत्यु: सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भ‍वश्च भविष्यताम् ।कीर्ति: श्रीर्वाक्‍च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृति: क्षमा ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas_translated: I am death, the all-devouring, and I am the origin of future beings. Among women, I am fame, prosperity, speech, memory, intelligence, fortitude, and patience.

slokas: बृहत्साम तथा साम्न‍ां गायत्री छन्दसामहम् ।मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकर: ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas_translated: Of the hymns of the Sama Veda, I am the Brihat-Saman; of meters, I am Gayatri. Of months, I am Margashirsha; of seasons, I am the season of flowers (spring).

slokas: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ।जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम् ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the gambling of the deceitful, I am the splendor of the splendid; I am victory, I am effort, I am the goodness of the good.

slokas: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जय: ।मुनीनामप्यहं व्यास: कवीनामुशना कवि: ॥ ३७ ॥
slokas_translated: Of the Vrishnis, I am Vasudeva; of the Pandavas, I am Dhananjaya (Arjuna). Among the sages, I am Vyasa; among the poets, I am Ushanas, the poet.

slokas: दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम् ।मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम् ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the rod of those who discipline, I am the policy of those who seek victory. I am also silence among secrets, and I am knowledge among the knowledgeable.

slokas: यच्च‍ापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन ।न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम् ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas_translated: And whatever is the seed of all beings, that am I, O Arjuna. There is no being, moving or unmoving, that can exist without Me.

slokas: नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप ।एष तूद्देशत: प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया ॥ ४० ॥
slokas_translated: There is no end to My divine manifestations, O conqueror of foes. What I have spoken is only a mere indication of My infinite opulences.

slokas: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा ।तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोऽशसम्भवम् ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas_translated: Whatever being is endowed with glory, prosperity, or power, know that it arises from a fraction of my splendor.

slokas: अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन ।विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत् ॥ ४२ ॥
slokas_translated: Or what need is there, Arjuna, for all this detailed knowledge? I stand sustaining this entire universe with a single fragment of myself.
